{{Unreferenced|date=August 2008}} {{Infobox Website | name = LinuxQuestions.org | logo = [[Image:LinuxQuestionsLogo.png]] | screenshot = | caption = | url = [http://www.linuxquestions.org/ LinuxQuestions.org] | commercial = no | type = [[Linux]] support forum | language = [[English Language|English]] | registration = required to post not view | owner = Jeremy Garcia | author = Jeremy Garcia | launch date = 2000 | current status = active | revenue = some adverts }} '''LinuxQuestions.org''' (commonly abbreviated '''LQ''') is a community-driven, self-help [[Website|web site]] for [[Linux]] users. As of August 2011, it has over 462,200 registered members. Started in [[2000]] by Jeremy Garcia, LQ is one of the most popular [[free software community]] sites and is usually reputed for helpfulness.<ref>http://www.jordomedia.com/RSS/l_op=viewrss/lid=110713.html</ref><ref>http://www.linuxquestions.org</ref>
The most popular section of the site are the [[Internet forum|forum]]s, where [[Linux]] users can share their knowledge and experience. Newcomers to the Linux world (often called [[newbie]]s) can ask questions and Linux experts can offer advice. Topics include [[Computer security|security]], installation, and [[Computer network|networking]]. Currently available forums fall into the following categories: LinuxQuestions.org, Linux, Enterprise Linux, Other *NIX Forums, Non-*NIX Forums. As of April 2009, the forums had more than 3.5 million posts.<ref>http://www.jordomedia.com/RSS/l_op=viewrss/lid=110713.html</ref><ref>http://www.linuxquestions.org</ref>
On March 5, 2004, LinuxQuestions.org set up a [[wiki]] aimed at building the largest online Linux [[knowledge base]]. The software used for this task is [[MediaWiki]].<ref>http://wiki.linuxquestions.org/wiki/Main_Page</ref>
LQ also has a section where one can download [[Compact Disc|CD]]/[[DVD]] [[ISO image]]s of Linux installation and [[Live CD]]s. Other than the download section and forums LQ also has the following sections: * Linux [[Podcast]] * LQ [[Radio]] * [[Linux distribution]]s [[review]]s * [[Book review]]s * Linux [[Tutorial]]s * Linux [[hardware compatibility list]] * Articles (member written and submitted) * Linux [[Internet bookmark|Bookmarks]] * Member [[Blog]]s <ref>http://iso.linuxquestions.org/</ref>
Despite its growth, it is still essentially run by one person — owner and founder Jeremy Garcia — with help from a team of [[Forum moderator|moderators]]. LQ is active in the community, often having either a stall or presence at [[:Category:Linux conferences|Linux conferences]] or expositions. These are primarily in the [[United States]], but have also been in the [[United Kingdom]] and in [[Canada]].
